intro: Saussurea kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Guangdong saussurea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellowish to brownish composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in mountainous regions with well-drained soil and is adapted to cooler climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
